summary: Build "MyLocal Kart" — an Instamart-like grocery delivery/catalog app with a unique futuristic UI, including separate public vs vendor logins and a vendor portal to upload/manage products, with item availability (online/offline) based on stock.
architectural_notes: Expand authorization model from single admin/owner to role-based access (public/customer vs vendor) with vendor-scoped catalog mutations via a vendor portal.
known_issues: Stray/legacy “Instamart”/“InstaMart” text may still appear in some UI/metadata; ensure all user-facing naming is consistently “MyLocal Kart” everywhere (including titles, alt text, footers, etc.).

existing_features.title: Create a coherent, unique futuristic visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across all screens using Tailwind CSS.
Add an admin product management UI that allows an authorized user to: add a new product via a form, remove an existing product, and toggle product availability (online/offline).

Define and enforce a minimal authorization model for catalog management actions so that only authorized identities can add/remove/toggle products (e.g., designate the deploying/initial principal as admin/owner and restrict mutations to that principal).

Implement a customer-facing catalog browsing UI similar in spirit to an Instamart storefront: show a grid/list of products, clearly indicate availability, and only allow browsing of available items by default (with an optional toggle to view offline items if the user is an admin).

Add generated image assets to the project and render them in the UI as static files from frontend/public/assets/generated (e.g., app logo in header, hero/cover image on the storefront, and a placeholder product image when none is provided).
Rebrand all user-facing app naming from “InstaMart”/Instamart-like text to “MyLocal Kart”, including the header logo title/alt text, footer copyright, and the HTML document title.

Add a clear, separate entry flow for “Public/Customer” vs “Vendor” usage: provide a mode selector (e.g., Customer vs Vendor) and make the login CTA reflect the selected mode so vendors know where to go to upload/manage products.
Create a Vendor Portal UI where authenticated vendors can upload (create) products and manage their catalog (at minimum: list their products, delete, and toggle availability).

Audit the entire frontend for any remaining user-facing occurrences of the strings “Instamart” or “InstaMart” (including headings, button labels, helper text, empty states, dialogs, alt text/aria-labels, metadata, and any other displayed copy) and replace them with “MyLocal Kart” so the brand name never appears as Instamart anywhere in the UI.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an Instamart-like grocery delivery app foundation with a unique futuristic design.
Implement product management: add items and remove items from the catalog.
Implement item availability controls: toggle items online/offline and re-enable when available.

Implement a product catalog backend with persistence that supports: creating items, listing items, deleting items, and updating an item's availability status (online/offline). Each product must include at minimum: id, name, description (optional), price, unit/quantity label (optional), image URL/path (optional), availability flag, and timestamps.
Add separate authentication flows/roles for public customers vs vendors (separate login).
Create a vendor dashboard/portal where vendors can upload and manage their products (add/edit/remove, set availability).
Introduce a vendor role in the backend authorization model and expose an API to determine the caller’s role so the frontend can reliably distinguish guest/customer/vendor/admin.
Associate products with an owning vendor identity and enforce vendor-scoped mutations: vendors can only create/manage their own products, while admins retain the ability to manage all products.
If updating persistent backend types/state is required to add vendor ownership/role fields, add an upgrade-safe migration (backend/migration.mo) so existing deployed state upgrades without data loss.
